question_1: What ingredient keeps meatloaf from falling apart?
answer_1: There can be many reasons why your meatloaf falls apart. The most common reason is that your meatloaf doesn't have enough binding agents. To help your meatloaf stay together add things in like eggs and bread crumbs because they are key ingredients that bind meat stick together.

question_4: Why do you add egg to meatloaf?
answer_4: Eggs are an ingredient in nearly every meatloaf, and they have two distinct roles. Egg yolks, which are mostly water but contain a good amount of protein and fat, add flavor, richness, and moisture. They also help bind the meat together and get the loaf to set in a stable form without the need to overwork the meat.
answer_5: Eggs: Like the breadcrumbs and milk, eggs act as a binding agent to hold the meatloaf together.

question_8: Is it better to use milk or water in meatloaf?
